message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LO, cs.SC, cs.NT. 

The paper deals with the decidability and complexity of a problem related to linear recurrence sequences, which is a topic in both computer science and mathematics. The use of Diophantine approximation suggests a connection to number theory (cs.NT). The mention of polynomial space and polynomial-time decision procedures suggests a connection to complexity theory (cs.CC). The focus on simple LRS and the use of lower bounds suggest a connection to discrete mathematics (cs.DS) and combinatorics (cs.CO). The mention of hard problems suggests a connection to computational complexity (cs.CC) and the use of the universal theory of the reals suggests a connection to real algebraic geometry (cs.SC).
